comments:
The following NPE is being thrown when deleting projectc from the workbench. I was not able reproduce the exception each and every time but happens very often. The WTP build used was 03/17 that contains JEM-SDK-1.2M2.

+++ Warning +++: Wed Mar 22 09:50:03 EST 2006    IWAV0002E Failed reflecting values.

+++ Warning +++: Wed Mar 22 09:50:03 EST 2006    java.lang.NullPointerException
    	at org.eclipse.jem.internal.adapters.jdom.JavaClassJDOMAdaptor.flushMethods(JavaClassJDOMAdaptor.java:250)

    	at org.eclipse.jem.java.internal.impl.JavaClassImpl.reflectMethods(JavaClassImpl.java:831)
    	at org.eclipse.jem.java.internal.impl.JavaClassImpl.getMethods(JavaClassImpl.java:559)

    	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EContentsEList$FeatureIteratorImpl.hasNext(EContentsEList.java:396)
    	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil$ProperContentIterator.hasNext(EcoreUtil.java:1104)
    	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.AbstractTreeIterator.next(AbstractTreeIterator.java:143)

    	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xmi.impl.XMLResourceImpl.doUnload(XMLResourceImpl.java:488)
    	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.unload(ResourceImpl.java:1152)
    	at org.eclipse.jem.internal.util.emf.workbench.ProjectResourceSetImpl.removeAndUnloadAllResources(ProjectResourceSetImpl.java:154)
    	at org.eclipse.jem.internal.util.emf.workbench.ProjectResourceSetImpl.release(ProjectResourceSetImpl.java:138)
    	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.integration.ResourceSetWorkbenchEditSynchronizer.release(ResourceSetWorkbenchEditSynchronizer.java:143)
    	at org.eclipse.jem.util.emf.workbench.ResourceSetWorkbenchSynchronizer.resourceChanged(ResourceSetWorkbenchSynchronizer.java:82)
    	at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.integration.ResourceSetWorkbenchEditSynchronizer.resourceChanged(ResourceSetWorkbenchEditSynchronizer.java:79)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:280)
    	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:274)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.handleEvent(NotificationManager.java:258)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastEvent(Workspace.java:250)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.unprotectedDelete(Resource.java:1642)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:695)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.delete(Project.java:345)
    	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction.delete(DeleteResourceAction.java:437)
    	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction.delete(DeleteResourceAction.java:412)
    	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction.access$0(DeleteResourceAction.java:402)
    	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction$3.run(DeleteResourceAction.java:522)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1736)
    	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.DeleteResourceAction$2.run(DeleteResourceAction.java:520)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Thanks. However, why is 

org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.integration.ResourceSetWorkbenchEditSynchronizer.release

trying to remove the JEM resource. The trace is indicating is trying to do that. It was never intended for a JEM resource to be removed from the resource set by anyone else. A JEM resource contains all of the JEM JavaClass's for a java package. It is the responsibility of JEM to handle any JEM XMLResource.

I see the difference now. It wasn't clear to me at first that you were deleting the project. In that case unload should of occurred. Sorry about that. It looked at first reading that it was just doing an unload due to some other resource change.

Failure during deleting is a bug. The fix has been released to HEAD.
